page.title: 15Changing Times
page.content: Fifty years ago many people worked on a farm,but today because of farm machinery,less work on the land and more travel to work in local towns.The heavy work was done by{horses}and lighter jobs by hand. The only machines used locally were a {self-binder}and a{threshing machine. Farm workers were allowed to snare {rabbits}for themselves and were sometimes given free milk, vegetables and eggs.Many workers lived in "tied cottages".This rarely happens today. During the winter, fifty years ago, a man from this area used to cycle to Colchester,buy bloaters, herrings and oranges and exchange them in the village for rabbit skins. Then women worked when needed on the farms picking peas and other vegetables Today some local women work through the year at local egg farms.
